SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.controller

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.controller.Controller
All Implemented Interfaces:
ControllerInterface, GameControllerReceiver, Serializable, Remote
public class Controller extends Object implements ControllerInterface, GameControllerReceiver
This class is the controller linked to every client It is used to manage interaction between the player and the server
See Also:

      Parameters:

  • Method Details

    • login

      public void login(String nickname)
      The method forwards the call to the lobbyGameListController to check if the nickname is already taken if it is not taken, the method sets the nickname of the player
      Specified by:
      login in interface ControllerInterface
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname chosen by the player

    • createLobby

      public void createLobby(String gameName, int maxPlayerCount)
      The method forwards the call to the lobbyGameListController to create a lobby
      Specified by:
      createLobby in interface ControllerInterface
      Parameters:
      gameName - the name of the lobby
      maxPlayerCount - the maximum number of players that can join the lobby

    • joinLobby

      public void joinLobby(String lobbyName)
      The method forwards the call to the lobbyGameListController to join a lobby
      Specified by:
      joinLobby in interface ControllerInterface
      Parameters:
      lobbyName - the name of the lobby to join

    • leaveLobby

      public void leaveLobby()
      The method forwards the call to the lobbyGameListController to leave the lobby
      Specified by:
      leaveLobby in interface ControllerInterface

    • chooseSecretObjective

      public void chooseSecretObjective(LightCard objectiveCard)
      The method checks if the gameController is not null (i.e. if the player is actually in a game) if it is not null, the method forwards the call to the gameController, to choose the secret objective card of the player, otherwise it sets the player as malevolent
      Specified by:
      chooseSecretObjective in interface ControllerInterface
      Parameters:
      objectiveCard - the secret objective card chosen by the player

    • choosePawn

      public void choosePawn(PawnColors color)
      The method checks if the gameController is not null (i.e. if the player is actually in a game) if it is not null, the method forwards the call to the gameController, to choose the pawn color of the player, otherwise it sets the player as malevolent
      Specified by:
      choosePawn in interface ControllerInterface
      Parameters:
      color - the pawn color chosen by the player

    • place

      public void place(LightPlacement placement)
      The method checks if the gameController is not null (i.e. if the player is actually in a game) if it is not null, the method forwards the call to the gameController, to place a card in from the hand to the codex,
      Specified by:
      place in interface ControllerInterface
      Parameters:
      placement - the placement of the pawn

    • draw

      public void draw(DrawableCard deckID, int cardID)
      The method checks if the gameController is not null (i.e. if the player is actually in a game) if it is not null, the method forwards the call to the gameController, to draw a card from the deck, otherwise it sets the player as malevolent
      Specified by:
      draw in interface ControllerInterface
      Parameters:
      deckID - the deck from which the card is drawn (either Resource or Gold)
      cardID - the position of the card to draw (0,1 for the buffer, 2 for the deck)

    • sendChatMessage

      public void sendChatMessage(ChatMessage message)
      The method checks if the gameController is not null (i.e. if the player is actually in a game) if it is not null, the method forwards the call to the gameController, to send a chat message, otherwise it sets the player as malevolent
      Specified by:
      sendChatMessage in interface ControllerInterface
      Parameters:
      message - the message to send

    • leave

      public void leave()
      The method checks if the gameController is not null (i.e. if the player is actually in a game) if it is not null, the method forwards the call to the gameController, to leave from the server, otherwise it sets the player as malevolent
      Specified by:
      leave in interface ControllerInterface

    • setGameController

      public void setGameController(GameController gameController)
      The method is used at the start of the game to set the game controller of the game the player is in
      Specified by:
      setGameController in interface GameControllerReceiver
      Parameters:
      gameController - the game controller to set
